intro: Carumbium acuminatum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts, and are often clustered in cyathia. The plant is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
